ADIRONDACK WINTER HP SERIES:

Basin Mountain Via Chicken Coop Brook Slide RT;

Optional Ascent of the Saddleback Cliffs

 

HIKE IT!


EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). Please feel free to email me with your thoughts about this trip. WORK TOWARD YOUR WINTER ADK LIST WITH US!   Be sure to review the entire post, with information links, before you go!

LODGING FOR THIS TRIP:  The Yellow Coach Motel, $50 / night.  Please reserve early and mention my name to get the lower rate!

Plan to spend the weekend in the area; I've posted a companion event for Mt. Marcy, Mt. Skylight and Gray Peak for the following day.  Note that you should plan to spend the night in Schroon Lake or Keene Valley for this hike, then relocate to the Lake Placid area for the following day's hike.

 

 

Total Mileage, Total Elevation Gain, Estimated Hike Time:

Basin Mountain RT:  About 15.6 miles RT, about 3,664' ASL (RT) vertical climbing; plan on 11 hours hike time.  

Basin Mountain + Saddleback Mountain Loop:  About 15.8 miles RT, about 3,989' ASL (RT) vertical climbing; plan on 11 hours hike time.  

 

The view of Mt. Marcy, Mt. Haystack and westward Adirondack High Peaks, From the Basin Mountain Summit.

 

SPECIAL GEAR / REQUIREMENTS: NOTE: Snow shoes, poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes and / or crampons, are ESSENTIAL as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Dress in non-wicking layers and bring extra gloves, socks and tops.    Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for these items; be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!  Bring extra batteries!!! Test your lights!!!

IF YOU DECIDE TO CLIMB SADDLEBACK MOUNTAIN: You may require wall climbing experience and belay equipment.

CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR NEW YORK STATE.

 

Climbing the steep sub-summit bump of Basin Mountain, north of the actual summit.


UPDATES (12/28/2011 11:15 a.m.):  

 Have you ever thought about hiking in the Adirondacks?  They are starkly different than any other mountains in the Northeast.  As relatively new mountains -- the result of an odd and unexplained hot spot under the earth's crust that continue to heave up dense anorthosite and other Canadian "basement" rocks -- they appear "Alp-like" in scale and character as you climb them.   More typically these hikes involve a long, gradual ascent into the back county -- and then you hit a wall and the final 1-2 miles to the summit ... and the glorious views of the Adirondack High Peaks!

 We'll use Chicken Coop Brook and see if we can explore the new slides to the Basin Mountain NE shoulder; otherwise this drainage route ascends directly below Saddleback Mountain ... where you can decide if you want to try to climb the cliffs!  First, we'll climb Basin Mountain and return.  If you climb Saddleback, you will return from the col along the State Range Trail before Gothics, descending via the Ore Bed Brook Trail.  Be prepared for awesome butt slides either way!!!

Plan to spend the weekend in the area; I'll post a companion event for Mt. Marcy, Mt. Skylight and Gray Peak for the following day.  Be sure to view, print out and take with you route information from the links below!

 

Nearing the top of the Chicken Coop Brook slide and the Basin-Saddleback col.


REQUIRED INBOUND ASSEMBLY POINTS:

  • Johns Brook Lodge.
  • Bushnell Falls Camping Area -- CHECK THE BLAZE COLOR CHANGE FROM YELLOW TO RED; bushwhack begins below at the Johns Brook / Chicken Brook confluence area.
  • Basin-Saddleback Col (meet here 1-2 times)


CLICK HERE: Google map link from Manchester NH to downtown Schroon Lake; then to The Garden parking area and the Phelps trailhead

Longest Estimated Drive Time From Meetup: 4 hours, 23 minutes; est. distance: 224 miles ONE WAY.


The route up the Saddleback cliffs ...

 

... and the look down! (don't look down!).
